intro: Microloma sagittatum subsp. pillansii, commonly known as the Pillans' arrowhead, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It features distinctive arrow-shaped leaves that are often tinged with red or purple at the base. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its unique foliage and compact growth make it a desirable ornamental plant in gardens.
